description.value:
You cause a length or section of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Rope] or a rope-like object to animate and follow simple commands. You can give it two commands when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Cast a Spell]{Cast the Spell}, and one command each time you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Sustain]{Sustain the Spell}.

  • Bind (attack) The Rope attempts to partially bind a creature. Attempt a spell attack roll against the target's Reflex DC. If you succeed, the target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed (-20-foot on a critical success). This ends if the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Escape]{Escapes} against your spell DC or breaks the Rope. (A standard adventuring Rope has Hardness 2, HP 8, and a Broken Threshold of 4.) @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Animate Rope]
  • Coil The Rope forms a tidy, coiled stack.
  • Crawl The Rope inches along the ground like a snake, moving one of its ends 10 feet. The Rope must move along a surface, but that surface doesn't need to be horizontal.
  • Knot The Rope ties a sturdy knot in itself.
  • Loop The Rope forms a simple loop at one or both ends, or straightens itself back out.
  • Tie The Rope ties itself around a willing creature or an object that's unattended or attended by a willing creature.
  • Undo The Rope undoes one of its knots, ties, or bindings.

Heightened (+2) The range increases by 50 feet, and you can animate 50 more feet of Rope.

target.value: up to 50 feet of rope or a nonliving rope-like object
